content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are very careful and tend to avoid risks. You prefer to take a conservative approach and avoid uncertainties. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Based on my careful and conservative approach, I would choose B{B} to minimize potential losses in cases where my opponent chooses R. This strategy allows me to earn 35$ for each of those instances, while still having a chance at earning 40$ if we both choose B. Over the course of 75 rounds, this strategy could result in a higher total earnings than choosing R and potentially earning nothing in some rounds due to mismatched choices.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Given my previous decision to minimize potential losses, I will continue with the strategy of choosing B{B} in the next round as well. This way, even if my opponent continues to choose R, I will still be able to earn 35$ for each of those instances, while having a chance at earning 40$ if we both choose B again in a future round.

Since both my opponent and I chose B in the previous round, we earned 40$ each. In this situation, it makes sense to continue with the strategy of choosing B{B} as it has been successful so far.
